alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 7:06AM MDT until April 18 at 8:55AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Jemez River Above Jemez Pueblo affecting Sandoval County. .Last weeks warm temperatures have caused rapid snowmelt and rises in the river. Cooler temperatures this weekend have slowed melt and lowered the river, though it remains elevated. Further rises are possible with the return of warmer temperatures this week. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...River is elevated and running fast with extremely cold water. * WHERE...Jemez River above Jemez Pueblo. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Between 7 and 8 feet multiple locations along highway 4 between San Ysidro and Jemez Springs will see water crossing the road from tributaries and low water crossing points. The Wastewater Treatment plant 1 mile downstream of Jemez Springs can be impacted between 7 and 7.7 feet. Water will be on Highway 4 at mile marker 1, 2 and 13. Homes near the river in San Ysidro could be impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM MDT Monday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 6.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 5.8 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will rise to 6.1 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall to 5.6 feet Friday morning. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.5 feet on 10/10/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Jemez River Jemez Puebl 8.0 5.9 Mon 6 am MDT 6.3 5.8 6.1 &&
info.instruction: Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 900 PM MDT.
